L)   Snapshot of Mom dancing very closely, too closely, t a handsy patron of the club. M)   Snapshot of Mom kissing the same man.   We see a tat on his arm. N)   Extreme closeup -- the tattoo. It is of a naked girl. The words "hell-bent" in cursive frame the tattoo. O)   Snapshot of Mom sitting on the tattooed man's lap at the bar. His hand is resting on the inner portion of her thigh. P)   Snapshot of Butch at the bar with the club bartender Q)   Same as (K) -- Butch being taught to dance.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: R)    Extreme closeup -- Butch in same photo. S)    Same as (J) -- Butch in bar with dime dancers. T)    Extreme closeup -- Butch in same photo. U)    Same as (O).   Mom with tattooed man. V)    Extreme closeup -- tattooed man from same photo. W)    Snapshot of crime scene in the bar. A man lies floor in a pool of blood. Onlookers, including      some the dime dancers and Butch's mom, express their     shock at the incident while police photographers and     newsme look on. X)    Extreme closeups    -- Some of the onlookers faces. Y)    Extreme closeup    -- Butch's mom's face. As  oppos the others, her    face is rather displaced.  You'd think she'd witnessed    a fender bender instead of a murder. Z)    Extreme closeup -- The face of the victim.      It' the tattooed man. AA)   Extreme closeup -- The tattoo. The ROAR of the MACHINE GROWL is now DEAFENING as the ima of the tattoo...

dialogues.speaker: BRILLIANT WHITE LIGHT
dialogues.text: that FILLS the FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except it's brighter than the brightest day as a high pow light shines directly at...

dialogues.speaker: BUTCH
dialogues.text: who exits his dream and enters reality with a throttled shock. He squints and tries to discern the source of the light while groping for his gun under the seat.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE LIGHT
dialogues.text: It's bright as hell but getting clearer, less fuzzy. We can now see it's the headlights of a huge COMBINE whic sits, ENGINE RUNNING, directly in front of the station wagon.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A BLACK MAN - 50 or so, KILLS the ENGINE (but leaves the lights on) steps down from the combine cab and starts toward the station wagon.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Phillip, now wide awake and scared.   He notices that... Butch is fingering the gun, resting it in his hands and under his right leg. The Black Man, whose name is Mack, crosses the front of t wagon and walks to the driver's side window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't mean to scare ya'. I work at night. It's cooler. Ya'lls car break down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me n' the boy was just catchin' some shut-eye in yer' field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it ain't mine. I just works it for Mr. Andrews. Where ya'll from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drove from Texarkana yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a haul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said a mouthful there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, ain't no sense in ya'll sleepin' in the car. Not when I got a fold out couch sittin' empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't want to put you out.     'Sides we need to get back on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No trouble t'all. Wake you up first light, fill yer' belly and send you on yer' way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Highway Patrol car, followed by a tow truck, breeze alo the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two officers, MONTGOMERY and HALL, scan the horizon.    T look like they've driven all night. Saunders wakes up in the back seat and leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't pass it did we? Saunders spots the RV on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patrol car stops, as does the tow truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hall and Montgomery view the beat to hell RV while Saunde ready to cry, jumps out and runs into the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Gawd Almighty. Governor ain't gonna' like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suttle is asleep among the rubble. He jumps to when Saunders bursts in. Saunders gasps when he sees the shape his prize vehicle is in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, uh, they're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, uh, four, five hours. Saunders, dejected, starts to move some of the trash from the couch. He sits down and moans...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, goddammit, did he say anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uh, Chief Garnett wanted me to tell you that the vehicle gets his seal of approval.... Saunders' face begins to turn red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that he wants his chair back. If he was red before, now Saunders is crimson.   A ther- mometer dropped into boiling water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a SCREAM and then a second later, Red's desk chai comes flying out the door. It hits a rock and splits as i bounces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Highway Patrol cars rocket along, one behind the othe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER JONES, a lean, hard-nose of 25, drives. Adler in the front seat, Red and Sally in the back. Not a word is spoken. Serious business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER OFFICER drives this car. Kaiser rides shotgun working the radio. In the back seat sit Bobby Lee and Bradley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COFFEEPOT RATTLES on the stove. Two black hands move the pot and rescue overfried eggs in a skillet on the stove. Two small black   feet dangle from a too-high bathroom toilet. As they    hit the ground we hear a FLUSH. We FOLLOW the feet   DOWN down a short hall and into the living room. As    they pass the bottom of a fold-out cou we... BOOM UP to reveal Butch and Phillip asleep. Butch's arm has found its way under Phillip's head and is acting as an early morning pillow.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A small head pops up on the side of the bed nearest Phillip. The six-year-old eyes of CLEVELAND peer close to Phillip and watch, only inches away, as Phillip sleeps Phillip's eyes blink a bit and then they open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaayyyyy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more scared)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaayyyy!!! Butch jumps up like a rocket and is on the floor in an instant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaayyyyy!!!! Cleve races into the kitchen and the apron strings of his grandmother, Mack's wife, LOTTIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wake ya'll up? (to Cleve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I told ya not to do that. BUTCH AND PHILLIP, breathing hard, can't help but laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No harm, Ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Lottie. Mack's wife.     This here's my grandbaby, Cleveland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's Cleve.   I'm six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm eight.   Mine's Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch, Cleve and Phillip finish breakfast while Lottie pours coffee. Cleve and Phillip, hitting it off well, are engaged in fervent storytelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got us a creek down the way. Wanna go later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing. Mack enters after a hard night's work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mornin' to ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mornin'.   Rest done ya'll some good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna plate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not jus' yet. (to Cleve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, go get my thermos from the truck. Cleve, still whispering and giggling with Phillip, isn't really listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ya hear good, boy?! Mack firmly cuffs the boy's ear and Cleve jumps up and ou the door, one hand holding the side of his head. Butch an Phillip both look up at Mack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy don't got the sense Gawd gave a chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to stay on Highway 70?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's head on over towards Amarillo. We'll cross him there or wave goodbye at the border.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip sits on   the couch and watches as Butch shows Cl a trick. Cleve    bends over, puts his hands between his and Butch grabs   them and pulls -- a flip. Cleve is ecstatic at the   result. Phillip and Butch laugh along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agin'!   Do it agin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Butch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the boy's mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We left her at home this time.   Boy's night out kinda thing. Butch spots an old phonograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, lookie here. He gives it a spin with his finger and searches through a stack of 78s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Andrews give 'em to us when he got hisself a newfangled one. Butch finds a particular favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeezus. Now this is music. You know how long it's been since I heard this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an oldie all right. Mrs. Andrews' maiden name was Bougeois -- half-Creole herself she is, but Mr. Andrews he don't like nobody to know. 'Suppose that's why he give 'em to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mack drops his pants and sits on the throne. He reaches over and turns ON the RADIO resting on the wash basin. A FARM REPORT comes on just as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NEEDLE DROPS on a 78, filling the room with the SCRATCH sounds of a Coonass waltz. Butch's eyes come to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dance, Lottie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawd goodness no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, jus' follow me. He takes her in his arms and slowly but surely adjusts he movement to his. After a few rough turns they're not too bad. Phillip can't help but smile as he and Cleve watch and giggle. Butch and Lottie dance, swirling around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Poe, you sure can move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oughta be able to. Was raised in a dime a dance whorehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yer' foolin' me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, ma'am. My mama would dance their asses out of the fryin' pan and into the back room fire. Butch spots Phillip and Cleve, watching, giggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on yer' feet, Buzz.     You'n Cleve shake a leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (encouraging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well go on! Cleve and Phillip reluctantly stand and stare at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dance, boys! The little boys do their best to emulate the adults and soon they're laughing and dancing, too. The RECORD STOPS. They all clap and laugh.         Butch something... The RADIO in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mack sits, cleaning his fingernails with a Barlow knife a the radio announcer begins a news flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Update on the manhunt for the escaped convict. Haynes is armed and extremely dangerous. He is believed to have a hostage with him, an eight-year-old boy. A finger turns OFF the RADIO. We FOLLOW the finger UP an arm TO Butch's concerned face. He sits down on the edge o the tub across from Mack and takes the knife away from hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be leavin' soon enough. I'll kill all of you if you try anything stupid. Mack swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lottie quizzes Phillip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Texarkana like? I ain't never been there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through his teeth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's real nice. I got a dog named... Phillip and a tree house and... Mack, nervous, enters the room followed by Butch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Buzz.   Time for us to hit the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whass' wrong, Mack? You look like you seen a ghost. Cleve runs up to Butch, turns around backwards and puts h hands between his legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me agin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared for the boy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   Boy! Get over by yer' Mammaw! Lottie senses something is wrong.   Cleve, too young to smell trouble, persists...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Mister, do me agin'!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Butch smiles and starts to oblige the boy, but Mack inter venes and smacks Cleve hard, sending him sprawling to the floor bawling. Butch, instantly enraged, back-hands Mack, grabs him by t collar and tosses him onto the floor. Phillip -- frozen, sitting, watching as things go from ba to worse. Cleve -- confused, bawling, afraid. Butch pulls    the gun from his pants, bends down, picks Mack by his    throat, presses the gun in his mouth and l him into a    chair beside Lottie. He bends close to Mack their noses    are inches apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd ya'   wanna' go and hit Cleve for? He didn't   move fast enough for ya', is that it?    Or maybe he gets excited sometimes   and don't hear everything ya' say? You    make me sick to my stomach. Butch spits in Mack's face, then rises and walks over to Phillip and hands him the revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point it at 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point it! Phillip does so, occasionally wiping a tear from his eye. Mack reaches down and holds Lottie's hand. Butch kneels down to a still-sobbing Cleve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, son, you wanna' flip? Cleve shakes his head "no" between sobs. Butch gently takes the boy and lifts him to a standing position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Put yer' hands between yer' legs. I won't hurt ya'. Cleve turns to Mack and then runs to him. Butch walks calmly over and pulls the crying child away from the old and back to the center of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He don't trust ya' no more. You gotta' earn that, ya' know? (to Cleve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put yer' hands 'tween yer' legs, son. Cleve,    still sobbing, does so. Butch reaches down and flips    him, all the while staring at Mack. Each time he flips    the boy, Butch reaches down, grabs Cleve's hands flips    him again. Finally he allows the frightened child to go to Mack and Lottie. Butch takes the gun from Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz.    Go out to the car and get that rope. Phillip stands frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip!... Phillip slowly rises and walks away.      He stops for a and turns his back.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: His eyes lock in a gaze with...

dialogues.speaker: CLEVE
dialogues.text: His sobbing eyes plead for something, anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip exits the house, walks past an old well to the station wagon. He opens the door, stops, looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch sits on the coffee table across from Mack, Lottie a Cleve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you hold that boy and tell him you love him. Mack grabs Cleve and sets him in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. Butch cocks the revolver and slides forward.     His nose almost touching Mack's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, old man.    Say it like you mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This boy know I loves him, mistah'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, mistah'. I gotta' sense about you. I know you a good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nome', I ain't a good man. Ain't the worst neither, jus' a different breed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip is at the screen door looking in.     He holds th in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch sits on the coffee table, which is pushed right up to Mack, Lottie and Cleve, who sit on chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch, enthralled with the episode he's directing, almost quivers with anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it, Mack.   Don't cost nuthin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Cleve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gawd that's beautiful. Butch spots Phillip standing at the entrance to the livin room with the bag. He takes it from the boy, empties the contents -- candy, cookies, bread, sugar and all -- and picks up the rope, takes Mack's Barlow knife from his pocket and cuts off a long shank. Butch takes the rope an begins to tie up the three.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Phillip stands, stares, aware that something bad is happening. Butch finishes tying, sticks the knife in his pocket and walks over to the PHONOGRAPH. He turns it back ON. The SCRATCHY RECORD plays. He turns UP the VOLUME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Phillip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go wait in the car or you can watch. Yer' old enough to think for yer'self. Phillip, unsure what to do, stands his ground. Butch returns to his seat   on the coffee table and stare at the three hostages. He    appears as if he's about to closes his eyes and rests   his chin on the barrel of the revolver while he recites   instructions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut yer' eyes, Cleve. Mack, you and Lottie hold the boy tight. Shut yer' eyes, too. Phillip, awkwardly aware that he's going to witness an execution, starts to cry out, then squelches himself. Butch seems to be in another world now -- taken to anothe place and time. A slight smile finds its way to his face, then disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, mistah', ain't no use in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll give you ever'thing we got! But Butch doesn't even hear the words. He slowly opens hi eyes, pulls his chin from the pistol barrel and points it at Mack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Father, which are in heaven, Hallo be thy name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lottie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh... shhh... shhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Thy Kingdom come, Lawd, thy will be done... here on Earth as it is in Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh.. shhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mack/Cleve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it wif' me.... Butch looks to Phillip in a strange way, sets the gun on the floor between them, and crawls amongst the candy, gum and wrappers until he finds the electrician's tape. Phillip watches, not knowing what to do. The revolver -- cocked, resting on the floor. MACK, CLEVE & LOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giv' us this day our daily bread and forgiv' us, Lawd, our trespasses as we forgiv' those who tresspass agin' us... Butch rips tape from the roll and slaps a piece over each of their mouths, silencing their prayers one by one. Out of breath, he kneels down in front of them and stares at the three while he reaches his hand behind him for the .... pistol -- but it's not there... Butch looks up to see... Phillip -- teeth gritted, holding the pistol, pointing it directly at Butch.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCH
dialogues.text: His expression is blank -- then a slight smile. For a second it's as if none of this has happened, that Butch w grasp Phillip in his arms... A DEAFENING GUNBLAST turns his expression to blank. Phillip, knocked to the floor by the revolver's kick, recovers to his knees, shaking like a leaf. The MAMBO RECORD comes to an END, but SCRATCHES ON AD INFINITUM. Butch falls back to his knees, still staring at Phillip. He looks at his stomach, where a stain of brown-red gushes through his T-shirt, and back to the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if he hasn't seen him in years)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip?....

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Phillip, momentarily dazed, stares at the gun in his hand at Butch, the blood pouring from Butch's side, and the shocked faces of Mack and his family. Then, in a flash, h runs, pell-mell, out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip blasts out the screen door and runs straight to t well. He drops the gun into the well, catches his breath and he for the road. After a few yards he has a thought, runs back to the station wagon, grabs the keys and throws them as far into the adjacent field as he can. Then he resumes his race fo the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch gropes to his feet, still in shock. He stumbles toward the door, then stops, reaches in his pocket, extracts Mack's Barlow knife, holds it up and walks towar them, staring hard. Mack, Cleve, Lottie -- Afraid they'll be killed after all Butch, surprisingly, meekly sets the knife down on the coffee table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for yer' hospitality. And walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch emerges and stumbles out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the horizon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip?!... No answer. He drags himself to the station wagon and, wit much effort, slides himself into the seat. No keys. He opens the door, crawls out, leaving a trail of blood, loo out to the road and starts to walk.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: runs down the road, looking back every so often to see if Butch is following

dialogues.speaker: BUTCH
dialogues.text: makes his way onto the private dirt and starts walking ba toward the main road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip?!! I won't hurt ya', I swear!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: is running out of steam on the road ahead.   He stops for blow and looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few hundred yards back, Butch struggles forward.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Phillip crawls through the ditch beside the road and squeezes through a barb wire fence. His costume hangs on a barb. He rips away from the fence leaving a foot-long strand behind. In the b.g. -- a pickup truck drives by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCH ANDREWS, 50, the owner of the Ranch, slows down when he sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: clad in his white costume, running across a field toward a grove of trees beside the creek.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Arch continues on down the road and passes... Butch -- nearly in shock, stumbling down the road.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK
dialogues.text: pulls into Mack's place, and Arch gets out, peers into th station wagon, sees blood, grimaces and walks up to the house. He notices a dripping trail of blood on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch enters the kitchen, sees no one and starts toward th living room. The MAMBO continues to SCRATCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mack?... Lottie?... Arch enters the living room and stops when he sees Mack a family, still gagged and tied to the chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch, holding his side, the pain is worse as he stumbles along. He stops when he spots something -- a piece of white costume on the fence. He crosses the ditch, steps through the fence and walks in the same direction Phillip did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a helluva' thing to do, Phillip. You're a hero. Prolly' be in all the papers tomorrow, how you saved those folks. Truth is, I don't think I woulda' killed 'em. I only killed two people in my whole life. One hurt my mama and one hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adler listens in on the shortwave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A town called Happy, over in Swisher County.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jones)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-hour tops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Adler)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the radio and tell whoever gets there first to play it nice and easy. Sally gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got the boy's mother flyin' in on a private. You want her on standby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeezus, who did that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guvner, I assume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead and chopper her in. After a moment of silence, Sally turns to Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to pry last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ya did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Red, it was 20 years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny thing. When the judge sent him away the kid stared at me. Like he knew. Not hard or mad like you'd expect. It was... It was like he was forgiving me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgiving you for what?! For looking at the facts and doing what you thought was right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw.   For what's gonna happen today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch follows Phillip's path through the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What say we talk this over? Settle things man to man. Then we can be on our way. I'll even let you drive. Knock that right off yer' list. How'd that be?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: finally arrives at the creek, looking over   his shoulder the way. He looks at the water -- deep and    running swi Where to go? He decides and heads for the    nearest tree a big oak, and shimmies up to a branch ten   feet or so a the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A country cop answering the report, drives slowly down th road, his pistol drawn and held upright in one hand. He pulls into Mack's driveway and parks. Arch walks out of the house to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his car. Took off on foot. He's got a pistol. Mack says it looks like a .38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch stops to rest.   Something catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white figure moves slightly in the boughs of an oak tre Phillip tries to climb higher but can't reach the next li

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Butch walks underneath the tree without even looking at Phillip. He sits down to rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alaska, Phillip.     Wild and wooley. Man against nature.     Me personally, I like them odds. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I tell you my   daddy lives there? He's the one that   sent the picture postcard. Listen    here to what he says about it... Butch pulls the postcard from his back pocket and reads..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Dear Robert'... that's my real name, Phillip. Robert. Jus' like old Bob the family man. 'Dear Robert, I just wanted to tell you that me leaving has nothing to do with you.' Phillip, still afraid, can't help but listen as Butch suffers through his memories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Alaska is a beautiful place.    Colder than hell most all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday you can come and visit and we'll maybe get to know each other better.' Short and sweet. That's the old man's style. 'Cold all the time' -- like that's a big sellin' point. He laughs to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He useta' pat me on the head and tell folks 'that it's some that can live life without askin' about it and it's others has to know why, and this boy here is one of the latters.' (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I wanted to go up there. To visit the old man, I guess. Prolly' punch him one first, but then maybe we'd end up bein' friends, sit down, have a beer, talk things over.... Butch groans. He pulls his hand from his side. Blood is oozing all over the place. He returns the postcard to his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll jus' rest awhile. Then you can make up yer' mind. How's that? Phillip, still clinging to the tree, can't help but feel compassion for his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen Highway Patrol cars now sit in the driveway. The Fed in charge, AGENT HENDRICKS, assigns different officer to secure the area in an incredibly organized fashion. Mack, Lottie, Cleve and Arch watch from the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch's eyes are closed. A small puddle of blood drips and becomes a rivulet running down into the creek. Phillip, still in the tree, still watching, can't bear it any longer. He slowly climbs down and drops next to Butch who opens his eyes to the boy and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing's for sure now -- I definitely believe in ghosts. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never been shot before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know ya' are. Truth is, if it had to happen, I'm glad it was you. As opposed to someone I don't know, I mean. All things considered, I feel pretty good, though. Could use a beer, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's beer taste like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's about the best thing there is. You'd better put that on the list. Phillip's eye catches something.     He stands up fearful

dialogues.speaker: TWO MORE PATROL CARS
dialogues.text: lights spinning, rushing down the road, kicking up dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally watches Red. When the car comes to a stop, she reaches out and touches his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think our chances of this thing ending peacefully are good. He smiles a lonesome smile, opens the door and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip kneels back down to Butch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, Phillip, I need me a time machine with a loud radio to take me where I'm goin'. Walkin's for squares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red exits his patrol car, followed by Sally.     Agent Hendricks walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garnett, I'm Tom Hendricks, F.B.I., out of the Amarillo office. I understand you have one of our men with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   You got the area quadroned off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water tight. Like a frog's pussy. (notices Sally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No doubt an observation based on personal experience. Red can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got him spotted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the creek, half-mile down the road. I spaced officers in a circle around them 100 yards or so away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any problem with me handling this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What say we both handle it? Red sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's head on down there.     Bradley, gimme' a megaphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One other thing, Chief. Haynes is wounded. The boy gut-shot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yer' shittin' me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip scoops a handful of water and brings it to Butch, who opens his mouth and drinks, A megaphoned voice interrupts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through megaphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch, this is Red Garnett of the Texas State Police. A thin, knowing smile crosses Butch's lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know yer' hurt. We've got damn near 100 armed men here. Take a look around and you'll see I'm shootin' ya' straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this for me. I'm touched, but I'm afraid ya'll gonna' have to back it up a step or two. I'm headed to Mexico. (to Phillip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyin' to 'em, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red leans against a patrol car, accompanied closely by Ad Sally and Hendricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into megaphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate    to tell ya', Butch, but yer' headed the    wrong direction. Tell ya' what. You    let the boy go and we'll talk about it.     Discuss it over a cold beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Phillip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer. What'd I tell ya'. (to Red)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appreciate the offer, Cap'n, but ya' know I can't do that. If you and yer' pals back outta' here, I'll drop the boy at the border. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't I'll shoot him in the head. I mean it! Phillip, betrayed beyond comprehension, stares at Butch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Phillip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me like that. I don't even have a gun. What did ya' do with the pistola' anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Threw it in the well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thinkin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya' think he means it? Red mulls it over, replaces his old chaw with a fresh one and looks to Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Based on what's happened the past two days I don't think he would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing's for sure. If he gets outta' here with the boy, we're right back to where we started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he kills the boy he'll get the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, he'll get the chair anyway.   He's killed two in two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know that he pulled the trigger on either of the innocent victims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he wasn't at home in his Strat-O- Lounger. 'Sides, who killed Pugh? Casper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, both of you, that's enough! From the trail of blood I got a feelin' it ain't gonna' make any difference. Let's jus' concentrate on gettin' the boy out for now. Bobby Lee approaches with a leather case, bypasses Red an goes straight to Hendricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where ya' want me, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you shoot off a hood? Bobby Lee nods. In the b.g., a HELICOPTER circles, preparing to land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be the boy's mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring her on over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch and Phillip watch the helicopter land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, Phillip, dreams do come true. There's yer' rocketship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think I'll get to ride it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today's the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (megaphoned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch, we got the boy's Mama here. She wants to say something. Phillip is visibly stunned by the news. He crawls up to the crest of the creekside and squints, looking for his mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Phillip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my mama. Phillip still cranes his neck to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that ya' got yerself a ghost suit, do ya' think she'll let ya' trick r' treat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (better than none)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to do one house. Butch smiles.   He has an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put yer' mask back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Lee carefully unsnaps the latches on his leather ca and opens it on the hood of the patrol car.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Inside is... a high-powered military rifle in three parts Hands unzip a velvetine bag and pull out a high-powered scope. Bobby Lee holds the lens of the scope to his mouth, blows breath on it and wipes it clean with a piece of clean cloth. He feels eyes and turns to see... Sally, watching him at work. Bobby Lee smiles at her, cocksure.   His dark role in thi manhunt is now perfectly clear. Sally turns her head, disgusted. Gladys Perry, frazzled, somewhat in shock, is ushered forward. She's handed the MEGAPHONE. She fumbles with it, pushes the button. It SQUAWKS LOUDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jus' push the button and talk normal. It SQUAWKS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, I'll hold the damn thing. You jus' talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into megaphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hullo... Hullo. Please, sir, he's my only son. I'll give you money, whatever I can. Please, I want to take my boy home! I want to... The MEGAPHONE SQUALKS one final dying time and SHORTS OUT Red hands it to Bradley, who immediately sets it on the trunk and starts taking it apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gladys)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yer' doin' fine. We'll get another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think yer' tobacco spit shorted it out, Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip wears the mask.   Butch dusts him off and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready to go home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very sure)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeahsir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Cap'n, you got any candy? INTERCUT BACK and FORTH BETWEEN Butch and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: megaphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, find another one! Red sighs and cups his hands around his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candy! Halloween candy! Popcorn balls, caramel apples, gum, shit like that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find me some candy and I'll deliver up a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Adler)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red nods to Adler who starts to gather sticks of gum, mints, anything from the surrounding officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't have another megaphone, Chief. Red just shakes his head and sighs. Bobby Lee leans on the hood of the car and places one eye behind the scope o his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say when, I'll say dead. Red glares at Bobby Lee for an extended moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells; to Butch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got yer'self a deal. Candy's waitin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more thing. His old lady has to swear to take him trick r 'treatin' every year. Phillip strains to look for his mom.    He's upset, ready leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme' yer' list, Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme that list. Phillip pulls it out. Butch snatches it and reads it to himself, laughing. He's on a death roll of sorts, between losing blood and being in an impossible situation he almo seems to be enjoying the macabre scenario as it unfolds. Phillip, on the other hand, is beginning to sob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's gotta promise to take him to the fair for rollercoasters and cotton candy whenever he wants... or at least once a year...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna' go home!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks list; yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when he gets older he gets to drink beer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need beer!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Phillip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's on yer' list. (yells to Red)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And to go out on dates with girls! (to Phillip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on the list, but you'll thank me later for that little addition. (checks list)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done that, got to drive, gonna' ride that rocketship. That's about it. (yells; to Red)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gotta' promise or I won't let him go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna' go home, Butch. My mama's not bad! She gives me those things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't kid a kidder, Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red, exasperated, he can't believe how weird this has gotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a deal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make her say it! Red looks to Gladys as if to say, "go ahead".   She seems reluctant. Red's frustration is showing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip is near tears. He rises and starts to move for the field, but Butch grab him with one arm, pulls him close and holds him like he's his own child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I jus' wanna' go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincere)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know jus' how ya' feel, Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Red)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip knows those things are against our beliefs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gladys)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinda' foolishness is that? (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She promises!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make her say it! Red gives her a look that says, "Say it or deal with me".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Phillip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we trust her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a real good mama. Butch reaches into his pocket, extracts the remaining wad of stolen bills, unzips the Casper outfit, stuffs them into the costume and rezips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Phillip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you get home, hide this. If she's lyin' you can buy yer' own damn beer. Phillip quiets for a moment and stares at Butch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yer' not bad, are you, Butch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Buzz, listen here. I want ya' to step out there real slow, keepin' yer' paws in the air. Then strut right over to them cops and yell 'trick r' treat.' Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna' do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin'll come to mind. Butch sticks out his hand.    Phillip shakes it, afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bye, Phillip.    It's been one helluva' ride. Butch nods and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Cap'n. Make way for Casper the friendly ghost. The friendliest ghost I know. Butch nudges Phillip and the boy starts toward the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adler, looking through binoculars, can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme' them things. Adler hands over the binoculars.    Red takes a look.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: nee Casper, walking in his full whitehood, arms reaching for the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip reaches level ground and for the first time sees the full strength of the amassed police forces -- at leas 20 cars, swirling lights, guns everywhere, pointing at hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Keep walkin'!

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH BINOCS
dialogues.text: Phillip stops walking and stands perfectly still.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Red lowers his binocs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell's he stoppin'? (to Gladys; direct)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call for yer' boy to come! Gladys, near shock, AD LIBS commands to Phillip. "Come on honey," "Phillip, keep walking," that kind of thing. (NOTE: Her commands become more and more shrieking and frantic and continue throughout, giving rise to even more confusion than is already present.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip turns back and sees ... Butch -- He tries to get up in an attempt to make a run f it, but his strength is gone. He collapses. Phillip, standing still, with his mother's shrieks fillin the air behind him, watches Butch for a second then runs back toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red sighs and lowers the binocs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip stands before a struggling Butch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personally I think we negotiated a pretty fair deal, but if there's somethin' else you want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they want to shoot you? Butch starts to lie to the boy but can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A finger strokes the trigger of a high-powered rifle. Bobby Lee -- Smiling, ready, waiting. Red shrugs and wipes his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thought better of releasin' the hostage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't necessarily mean that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bobby Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay on ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip holds his hand out and helps Butch get up. Butch stands, dusts himself off, grabs the boy's hand and to- gether they walk toward the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red, through the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen it all now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch and Phillip, hand in hand, walking across the field

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red scratches his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell if I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's giving himself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep in mind -- he still has the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells; to Butch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch! Stop and let the boy go! Put yer' hands up and let the boy go!!! (NOTE:   AD LIB instructions from Red continue as well.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all the yelling, it's hard to make out what's being said. Butch and Phillip continue to walk and talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess that's it for Alaska, Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop and put your hands on your head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run, Phillip!   Come here, Phillip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a warning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, we've got an armed killer and an innocent boy out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bobby Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You clean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep him locked down.    Don't squeeze til' I say 'when.' Red holds Bobby Lee's eyes until the young Fed nods.    T Red unstraps his holster and moves between the cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell you going? But Red's not listening, just walking, long and tall, int the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch and Phillip continue to walk, Butch holding Phillip hand. When Butch spots Red approaching he slows and then stops. Red shows his palms and keeps walking toward them.     Wh he gets within 25 feet he stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm unarmed.    Toss your gun on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Butch smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had a pistola I'd be headed the other direction. My partner here got rid of the evidence. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you, friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm. Well, look I wanna' talk to the boy and then we'll take care of bidness. How's that? Only take a second. Red nods then looks over his shoulder at the patrol cars lined up like a wagon train, guns aimed, Bobby Lee peerin through the scope of his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch and Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna' give ya' somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna make a run for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it a second!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bobby Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let the boy go, Butch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bobby Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he makes a move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch kneels down beside Phillip.    He reaches slowly, p fully for his back pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mebe' someday you'll get to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hendricks looks through the binocs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's goin' for his weapon!

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: Butch reaches into his back pocket...

dialogues.speaker: IN FIELD
dialogues.text: Red squints to make out what Butch's reaching for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch smiles as he retrieves the POSTCARD from his pocket

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: A look of concern crosses Red's lips...

dialogues.speaker: ROADSIDE
dialogues.text: Sally realizes it's not a gun that Butch is reaching for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooooo...!!!!

dialogues.speaker: FINGER ON TRIGGER
dialogues.text: squeezes -- An EXPLOSION followed by a RINGING ECHO.

dialogues.speaker: IN FIELD
dialogues.text: Butch's chest explodes when the bullet hits him. He rocks backwards, still on his knees... and looks at Phillip in amazement. Phillip screams, grabs Butch and holds him up.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH CROSSHAIRS OF GUN
dialogues.text: Phillip is obscuring a second shot at Butch.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCH
dialogues.text: tastes blood and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, Buzz, shot twice in the same day. He collapses and falls into Phillip's arms. Phillip backs away two steps and falls to his knees. Butch wavers for a second then topples on his back. Phillip moans, sobs, as he watches Butch, the GUNSHOT sti ECHOING.

dialogues.speaker: AT ROADSIDE
dialogues.text: Gladys runs from behind the car, followed by a host of officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep everybody back! Bobby Lee stands, lowers his rifle disengages and smiles Hendricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need to worry.     He can't hurt nobody now.

dialogues.speaker: IN FIELD
dialogues.text: Red stands frozen, staring, in another world. An OFFICER trots up to Butch and does a careful ground frisk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No weapon, Chief! Red "comes to," turns and walks toward the...

dialogues.speaker: ROADSIDE
dialogues.text: Red walks   up to Bobby Lee, stops and stares at the grin marksman.    After a beat, Red turns then nearly jumps ou shoes with   a sudden right cross that floors the younger Red starts   to jump in for more but Hendricks, stunned, in, grabs   Red and, joined by four other Officers, holds older man   back. Shouting, i.e. "Hey, hey, Red, whoa, wh Red settles a bit. Hendricks turns to Bobby Lee who rises to one knee and wipes at a bloody lip, and then to Red wh is still breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that all about?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say 'when.'

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Red turns and walks away. Hendricks throws his hat to the ground, kicks it and follows Red with his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to no one/everyone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit!! Adler catches up to Red.   He stares at his old friend an boss as they walk along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he had a gun, too, Red.   There was just no way of knowin'. Red doesn't even look at Adler, just keeps walking.    Ad stops, his eyes following Red. Sally, nearby, watches Red walk away.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: is helped to his feet by his mother. She holds him dearly to her chest. He hugs back just as hard, his blood-staine Casper outfit staining her blouse. She unzips the costume and dollar bills fly all around. She starts to lead Phillip off but he won't leave until... He pulls the postcard from Butch's hand.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Staring down at Butch.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCH
dialogues.text: His eyes flutter a bit with recognition.

dialogues.speaker: AT PATROL CAR
dialogues.text: Red leans against the car.   After a few seconds Sally wa up and finds a spot a few feet down from him where she, t leans against the car. After a few more seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did everything you could.    You know that. Red just stares straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know nuthin'.   Not a damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Red reaches into his pocket, pulls out his tobacco and stuffs a chunk into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: IN FIELD
dialogues.text: He licks his lips as the MUFFLED VOICES CONTINUE around him. He squints hard and sees:

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: as it lifts off and speeds away.    As it wipes the sun..

dialogues.speaker: BUTCH
dialogues.text: A slight smile crosses his dying face as he squints to see Phillip's flight.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Nose pressed against the glass bubble.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCH
dialogues.text: His eyes don't close, still squinted but frozen.

dialogues.speaker: EYES
dialogues.text: We realize now, are lifeless.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZARD
dialogues.text: continues its flight past the sun.

dialogues.speaker: SUN
dialogues.text: flares, SENDING the SCREEN TO:

dialogues.speaker: MILKY WHITE IMAGE
dialogues.text: that opened the film.
